name: Discussion Group: Introduction to Contributing to WordPress
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: An Introduction to the WordPress Open-Source Project!

To prepare for this discussion, please watch this workshop in advance: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/an-introduction-to-the-wordpress-open-source-project/.

Even if you are brand new to Open Source and the WordPress Project, you are welcome to participate! Bring your questions, your thoughts, comments to this informal discussion.

For more information, visit https://make.wordpress.org/community/

name: Discussion Group: WordPress Troubleshooting Basics: Part 1
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: WordPress Troubleshooting Basics: Part 1.

To prepare for this discussion, please watch this workshop in advance: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/wordpress-troubleshooting-basics-part-1/

This workshop covers the basics of WordPress troubleshooting. It is aimed at a beginner audience and will cover the strategy to troubleshoot WordPress issues, along with some common troubleshooting steps that will help in fixing many common WordPress issues.

Please watch the video first and join us for a discussion to answer any questions that you have on translating WordPress.

name: Discussion Group: Who am I to be speaking? + Finding a topic for a WP event
description:
If you are from a marginalized or underrepresented group in WordPress in terms of gender, race, class, sexuality, ability, age, etc. join us for a discussion on this workshop: Who am I to be speaking + Finding a topic.

To prepare for this discussion, please watch this workshop in advance: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/diverse-speaker-training-workshop-part-1/

We invite you to do the exercises along with the video, and bring your answers to the discussion group to get feedback.

This workshop is geared towards people from marginalized or underrepresented groups in WordPress who are intrigued by the idea of speaking at an online WordPress event. The focus is to look at what has stopped you from speaking in the past and explore how to move past your fears, generate WordPress-related topics to give a talk on, and boost your speaking confidence.

You can join this discussion on its own or with the other 2 discussions of this series this week. It is the same zoom link for all 3.

name: Discussion Group: Writing a pitch for being accepted to speak at a WP event
description:
If you are from a marginalized or underrepresented group in WordPress in terms of gender, race, class, sexuality, ability, age, etc. join us for a discussion on this workshop: Writing a pitch

To prepare for this discussion, please watch this workshop in advance: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/diverse-speaker-training-workshop-part-2/

We invite you to do the exercises along with the video, and bring your title, pitch, and bio to the discussion group to get feedback.

This workshop is geared towards people from marginalized or underrepresented groups in WordPress who are intrigued by the idea of speaking at an online WordPress event. The focus is to look at creating a workshop description (aka pitch) and bio that has a higher chance of being accepted by speaker selection committees.

You can join this discussion on its own or with the other 2 discussions of this series this week. It is the same zoom link for all 3.

name: Discussion Group: Online Stage Presence for speaking at WordPress events
description:
If you are from a marginalized or underrepresented group in WordPress in terms of gender, race, class, sexuality, ability, age, etc. join us for a discussion on this workshop: Online Stage Presence

To prepare for this discussion, please watch this workshop in advance: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/online-stage-presence/

This workshop is geared towards people from marginalized or underrepresented groups in WordPress who are intrigued by the idea of speaking at an online WordPress event. The focus is to have better stage presence – in general for any stage, as well as specifically for presenting from your computer for online events.

You can join this discussion on its own or with the other 2 discussions of this series this week. It is the same zoom link for all 3.

name: Discussion group: Organizing WordPress Meetups - Getting Started
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: Organizing WordPress Meetups - Getting Started!

Note: We will be hosting this discussion in the Making WordPress Slack in the #community-events channel. In case you don't have an account already, sign-up for an account here: https://make.wordpress.org/chat/

To prepare for this discussion, please watch this workshop in advance: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/organizing-wordpress-meetups-getting-started/

This workshop is geared toward at all WordPress Community members that wish to be a part of the WordPress community, to organize a WordPress meetup. You can join the discussion group even if you are an experienced community organizer.

Bring us all the questions you have, and we're happy to answer all questions you have!

name: Discussion Group: WordPress Troubleshooting Basics
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: WordPress Troubleshooting Basics.

The event is happening on November 27, 2020 (Friday) at 14:00 UTC: https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?iso=20201127T1400

To prepare for this discussion, please watch these workshops in advance: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/wordpress-troubleshooting-basics-part-1/
https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/wordpress-troubleshooting-basics-part-2-troubleshooting-with-logs/

These workshops cover the basics of WordPress troubleshooting. It is aimed at a beginner audience and will cover the strategy to troubleshoot WordPress issues, along with some common troubleshooting steps that will help in fixing many common WordPress issues.

Please watch the videos first and join us for a discussion to answer any questions that you have on troubleshooting WordPress.

name: Discussion Group: WordPress Troubleshooting Basics

name: WordPress Dashboard Overview
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: WordPress Dashboard Overview.

You can find a link to the workshop below:
https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/wordpress-dashboard-overview/

In this workshop, we cover everything you need to know to find your way around your WordPress site’s Dashboard. Starting a new site can feel daunting, but once you know the tools available to you – and where to find them – it is easier to take those first steps forward.

Please watch the videos first and join us for a discussion to answer any questions that you have on navigating the WordPress Dashboard.

NOTE: We will be hosting this discussion in the Making WordPress Slack in the #community-events channel. Sign-up for an account here: https://make.wordpress.org/chat/

name: Discussion Group: Introduction to Open-Source
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: Introduction to Open-source.

This event is happening on December 8, 2020 at 06:00 UTC https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?iso=20201209T0600

To prepare for this discussion, please watch this workshop in advance: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/introduction-to-open-source/.

Even if you are brand new to open-source and WordPress, you are welcome to participate! Bring your questions, thoughts, and comments to this informal discussion!

name: How To Find Help With WordPress
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: WordPress Dashboard Overview. You can find a link to the workshop below:
https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/how-to-find-help-with-wordpress/

In this workshop, participants will learn how to find help in fixing problems, along with various resources that can be helpful, when you are stuck trying to implement a feature, plugin, or theme.

Please watch the videos first and join us for a discussion to answer any questions that you have on navigating the WordPress Dashboard.

To prepare for this discussion, please watch this workshop in advance: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/introduction-to-open-source/.

name: Discussion Group: User Management
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: User Management

The event is happening on December 16, 2020 (Wednesday) at 17:00 UTC. We will be hosting this discussion over Zoom.

To prepare for this discussion, please watch these workshops in advance: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/user-management/

In this workshop you’ll learn how to add, edit, and remove users within your WordPress website. This workshop will introduce the user roles that exist within WordPress, but will focus on the how-to of user management, and not the organizational philosophy behind deciding which users are assigned various roles and permissions.

Please watch the videos first and join us for a discussion to answer any questions that you have on managing users with WordPress.

name: WordPress Dashboard Overview
description:
Join us for a text discussion on this workshop: WordPress Dashboard Overview.

You can find a link to the workshop below:
https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/wordpress-dashboard-overview/

In this workshop, we cover everything you need to know to find your way around your WordPress site’s Dashboard. Starting a new site can feel daunting, but once you know the tools available to you – and where to find them – it is easier to take those first steps forward.

Please watch the videos first and join us for a discussion to answer any questions that you have on navigating the WordPress Dashboard.

name: Discussion: Introduction to Contributing to the WordPress Open Source Project
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: Introduction to Contributing to WordPress.

Note: We will be hosting this discussion in the Making WordPress Slack in the #community-events channel. Sign-up for an account here: https://make.wordpress.org/chat/

To prepare for this discussion, please watch this workshop in advance:
https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/an-introduction-to-contributing/

Even if you are brand new to open-source and WordPress, you are welcome to participate! Bring your questions, thoughts, and comments to this informal discussion hosted by Erica V.

name: Discussion Group: WordPress Troubleshooting Basics
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: WordPress Troubleshooting Basics.

The event is happening on January 8, 2021 (Friday) at 06:00 UTC: https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?iso=20210108T0600

To prepare for this discussion, please watch these workshops in advance: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/wordpress-troubleshooting-basics-part-1/
https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/wordpress-troubleshooting-basics-part-2-troubleshooting-with-logs/

These workshops cover the basics of WordPress troubleshooting. It is aimed at a beginner audience and will cover the strategy to troubleshoot WordPress issues, along with some common troubleshooting steps that will help in fixing many common WordPress issues.

Please watch the videos first and join us for a discussion to answer any questions that you have on troubleshooting WordPress.

name: Using WordPress in Other Languages
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: Using WordPress in Other Languages.

This event is happening on January 12 at 0:00 UTC.

To prepare for this discussion, please watch this video workshop in advance: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/using-wordpress-in-other-languages/

This discussion group will be hosted by Naoko and Erica. Please bring any questions you may have about using WordPress in multiple languages. Whether you have been using WordPress in multiple languages for years or are just getting started, all levels are welcome!

name: Discussion Group: Introduction to Open-Source
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: Introduction to Open-source.

This event is happening on January 13, 2021 at 16:00 UTC https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?iso=20210113T1600

To prepare for this discussion, please watch this workshop in advance: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/introduction-to-open-source/.

Even if you are brand new to open-source and WordPress, you are welcome to participate! Bring your questions, thoughts, and comments to this informal discussion!

name: How to Install WordPress
description:
Join us for a text discussion on this workshop: How to Install WordPress

You can find a link to the workshop below:
https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/how-to-install-wordpress/

In this workshop, we cover everything you need to know to install WordPress on a server and get your site up and running. Setting up hosting and installing WordPress can feel daunting, but once you know the steps required to see you through, it’s easy!

Please watch the videos first and join us for a discussion to answer any questions that you have on navigating the WordPress Dashboard.

name: Watch party + Discussion group: Custom CSS in the Editor
description:
Join us for a watch party + discussion on this workshop: Custom CSS in the Editor

The event is happening on January 19, 2021 (Friday) at 09:00 UTC: https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?iso=20210119T0900

We will be watching the following Learn WordPress workshop during the session: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/custom-css-in-the-editor/

From customizing a block to adding a class in the advanced CSS field, this workshop will guide you through the process of customizing the editor using simple CSS. There will also be a little trip into using the inspector along the way to find the perfect class.

Then after watching the workshop together, we will open the last part of the hour for discussion about the workshops. In the discussion that follows, we will try to answer any questions that you working with Custom CSS in the WordPress editor.

name: Discussion group: How To Find Help With WordPress
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: WordPress Dashboard Overview. You can find a link to the workshop below:
https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/how-to-find-help-with-wordpress/

In this workshop, participants will learn how to find help in fixing problems, along with various resources that can be helpful, when you are stuck trying to implement a feature, plugin, or theme.

Please watch the video first and join us for a discussion to answer any questions that you have about finding help with WordPress.

name: Watch Party & Discussion: Contributing to the WordPress Open Source Project
description:
Join us for a Watch Party and Discussion of some workshops about Contributing to the WordPress Open Source Project!

We will be watching two workshops during the hour:
“Introduction to Contributing to WordPress”
https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/an-introduction-to-the-wordpress-open-source-project/
and
“Contributing on the WordPress Community Team”
https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/contributing-on-the-wordpress-community-team/

Then after watching these workshops together, we will open the last part of the hour for discussion about the workshops. Cami and Courtney will be there to answer your questions about contributing to WordPress and the Community Team!

Even if you are brand new to the WordPress Community or the WordPress Open Source Project, you are welcome to participate! Bring your questions, your thoughts, comments to our informal discussion.

name: Watch Party + Discussion group: Getting Started in eCommerce Idea > 1st Customer
description:
Join us for a watch party + discussion on this workshop: Getting Started in eCommerce: From Idea to First Customer

The event is happening on January 25, 2021 (Friday) at 15:00 UTC: https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?iso=20210125T1500

We are going to watch the Learn WordPress workshop on: "Getting started in E-Commerce: From idea to first customer (link: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/getting-started-in-ecommerce-from-idea-to-first-customer/ ) together in this discussion group. Thereafter, we will have an open discussion on the workshop contents where we all can discuss the contents of the workshop and find answers to questions.

This workshop will talk about kicking off an eCommerce store and helping it succeed. While this is intended for anyone that wants to set up an E-Commerce store, anyone can watch this workshop and participate in the discussion to learn more about how to succeed with an E-Commerce store!

Come, join us, for an interactive discussion on how to succeed as an E-Commerce store owner!

name: Discussion: Introduction to Contributing to the WordPress Open Source Project
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: Introduction to Contributing to WordPress.

Note: We will be hosting this discussion in the Making WordPress Slack in the #community-events channel. Sign-up for an account here: https://make.wordpress.org/chat/

To prepare for this discussion, please watch this workshop in advance:
https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/an-introduction-to-contributing/

Even if you are brand new to open-source and WordPress, you are welcome to participate! Bring your questions, thoughts, and comments to this informal discussion hosted by Erica V.

name: Discussion Group: Using the Media Library
description:
Join us for a text discussion on this workshop: “Using the Media Library”

You can find a link to the workshop below:
https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/using-the-media-library/

In the workshop, we introduce you to the Media Library in WordPress. We go over the Grid and List views, and how to navigate those views. We also do an overview of working within the Media Library.

Please watch the video first, then join us for this discussion group to talk about the workshop and discuss any questions that you may have on using the Media Library. You can opt to watch the video at the beginning of this event (it's only 16 minutes!) and join us for the open discussion during the rest of the hour.

NOTE: We will be hosting this discussion in the Making WordPress Slack in the #community-events channel. Sign-up for an account here: https://make.wordpress.org/chat/

name: Discussion group: Advanced Layouts with the Block Editor
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: Advanced Layouts with the Block Editor. You can find a link to the workshop below:
https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/advanced-layouts-with-the-block-editor/

In this workshop, participants will learn the core concepts of basic blocks provided in all current WordPress installs. We also explore the anatomy of advanced block layout and how to construct more complex and attractive layouts by just using blocks – without any custom code or plugins.

Please watch the video first and join us for a discussion and bring answer any questions that you have about creating an advanced layout in the block editor.

name: Discussion group: How To Find Help With WordPress
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: WordPress Dashboard Overview. You can find a link to the workshop below:
https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/how-to-find-help-with-wordpress/

In this workshop, participants will learn how to find help in fixing problems, along with various resources that can be helpful, when you are stuck trying to implement a feature, plugin, or theme.

Please watch the video first and join us for a discussion to answer any questions that you have about finding help with WordPress.

name: Discussion Group: Intro to Publishing with the Block Editor
description:
Join us for a discussion on this workshop: Intro to Publishing with the Block Editor!

To prepare for this discussion, please watch this workshop in advance: https://learn.wordpress.org/workshop/intro-to-publishing-with-the-block-editor/

This workshop is geared toward new and experienced publishers alike, looking to learn more about using the block editor. Bring your questions, thoughts, and comments to this informal discussion.
